bean.name: CaffeineAggregationRepository
bean.title: Caffeine Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses Caffeine Cache to store exchanges.

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: CaffeineIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Caffeine Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses Caffiene cache to store message ids.

bean.name: CassandraAggregationRepository
bean.title: Cassandra Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses Cassandra table to store exchanges. Advice: use LeveledCompaction for this table and tune read/write consistency levels.

table.description: The table name for storing the data

prefixPKValues.description: Values used as primary key prefix. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

pkColumns.description: Primary key columns. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

ttl.description: Time to live in seconds used for inserts

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: CassandraIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Cassandra Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses Cassandra table to store message ids. Advice: use LeveledCompaction for this table and tune read/write consistency levels.

table.description: The table name for storing the data

prefixPKValues.description: Values used as primary key prefix. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

pkColumns.description: Primary key columns. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

ttl.description: Time to live in seconds used for inserts

bean.name: CronScheduledRoutePolicy
bean.title: Cron Scheduled Route Policy
bean.description: A cron based RoutePolicy that can be used to start/stop routes at specific times.

routeStartTime.description: Cron expression for when the route should be started

routeStopTime.description: Cron expression for when the route should be stopped

routeSuspendTime.label: advanced
routeSuspendTime.description: Cron expression for when the route should be suspended

routeResumeTime.label: advanced
routeResumeTime.description: Cron expression for when the route should be resumed

timeZoneString.description: To use a specific timezone (ID such as CET)

bean.name: DefaultHeaderFilterStrategy
bean.title: Default Header Filter Strategy
bean.description: The default header filtering strategy. Users can configure which headers is allowed or denied.

inFilter.description: Sets the in direction filter set. The in direction is referred to copying headers from an external message to a Camel message. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma

outFilter.description: Sets the out direction filter set. The out direction is referred to copying headers from a Camel message to an external message. Multiple patterns can be separated by comma

lowerCase.label: advanced
lowerCase.description: Whether header names should be converted to lower case before checking it with the filter Set. It does not affect filtering using regular expression pattern.

allowNullValues.label: advanced
allowNullValues.description: Whether to allow null values. By default a header is skipped if its value is null. Setting this to true will preserve the header.

caseInsensitive.label: advanced
caseInsensitive.description: Sets the caseInsensitive property which is a boolean to determine whether header names should be case insensitive when checking it with the filter set. It does not affect filtering using regular expression pattern.

filterOnMatch.label: advanced
filterOnMatch.description: Sets what to do when a pattern or filter set is matched. When set to true, a match will filter out the header. This is the default value for backwards compatibility. When set to false, the pattern or filter will indicate that the header must be kept; anything not matched will be filtered (skipped).

bean.name: DurationRoutePolicy
bean.title: Duration Route Policy
bean.description: RoutePolicy which executes for a duration and then triggers an action. This can be used to stop the route after it has processed a number of messages, or has been running for N seconds.

maxSeconds.description: Maximum seconds Camel is running before the action is triggered

maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages to process before the action is triggered

bean.name: DurationRoutePolicyFactory
bean.title: Duration Route Policy Factory
bean.description: RoutePolicyFactory which executes for a duration and then triggers an action. This can be used to stop a set of routes after they have processed a number of messages, or has been running for N seconds.

fromRouteId.description: Route pattern to select a set of routes (by their route id). By default all routes are selected

maxSeconds.description: Maximum seconds Camel is running before the action is triggered

maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages to process before the action is triggered

bean.name: EhcacheAggregationRepository
bean.title: Ehcache Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses Caffeine Cache to store exchanges.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

bean.name: EhcacheIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Ehcache Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses EHCache cache to store message ids.

bean.name: ElasticsearchBulkRequestAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Elasticsearch Bulk Request Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregates two ElasticSearch BulkOperation into a single BulkRequest

bean.name: Etcd3AggregationRepository
bean.title: Etcd3 Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses Etcd3 to store exchanges.

prefixName.description: Prefix to use as primary key

persistencePrefixName.label: advanced
persistencePrefixName.description: Prefix to use as primary key for completed exchanges

optimistic.description: Whether or not to use optimistic locking

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: FileIdempotentRepository
bean.title: File Idempotent Repository
bean.description: A file based idempotent repository. Comes with 1st-level in-memory cache for fast check of the most frequently used keys.

cacheSize.description: The maximum size of the 1st-level in-memory cache

fileStore.description: File name of the repository (incl directory)

maxFileStoreSize.description: The maximum file size for the file store in bytes. The default value is 32mb

dropOldestFileStore.description: Sets the number of oldest entries to drop from the file store when the maximum capacity is hit to reduce disk space to allow room for new entries.

bean.name: GroupedBodyAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Grouped Body Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregate body of input Message into a single combined Exchange holding all the aggregated bodies in a List of type Object as the message body. This aggregation strategy can be used in combination with Splitter to batch messages.

bean.name: GroupedExchangeAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Grouped Exchange Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregate all Exchanges into a single combined Exchange holding all the aggregated exchanges in a List of Exchange as the message body. This aggregation strategy can be used in combination with Splitter to batch messages.

bean.name: GroupedMessageAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Grouped Message Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregate all Message into a single combined Exchange holding all the aggregated messages in a List of Message as the message body. This aggregation strategy can be used in combination with Splitter to batch messages.

bean.name: HazelcastAggregationRepository
bean.title: Hazelcast Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses Hazelcast Cache to store exchanges.

hazelcastInstance.description: To use an existing Hazelcast instance instead of local

persistenceMapName.label: advanced
persistenceMapName.description: Name of cache to use for completed exchanges

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: HazelcastIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Hazelcast Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses Hazelcast cache to store message ids.

hazelcastInstance.description: To use an existing Hazelcast instance instead of local

bean.name: InfinispanEmbeddedAggregationRepository
bean.title: Infinispan Embedded Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses embedded Infinispan to store exchanges.

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: InfinispanEmbeddedIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Infinispan Embedded Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses embedded Infinispan to store message ids.

bean.name: InfinispanRemoteAggregationRepository
bean.title: Infinispan Remote Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses remote Infinispan to store exchanges.

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: InfinispanRemoteIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Infinispan Remote Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses remote Infinispan to store message ids.

bean.name: JCacheAggregationRepository
bean.title: JCache Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses JCache to store exchanges.

optimistic.description: Whether optimistic locking is in use

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

bean.name: JCacheIdempotentRepository
bean.title: JCache Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses JCache to store message ids.

bean.name: JdbcAggregationRepository
bean.title: Jdbc Aggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses SQL database to store exchanges.

dataSource.description: The DataSource to use for connecting to the database

transactionManager.description: The Spring TransactionManager to use for connecting to the database

headersToStoreAsText.description: Allows to store headers as String which is human readable. By default this option is disabled, storing the headers in binary format. Multiple header names can be separated by comma.

storeBodyAsText.description: Whether to store the message body as String which is human readable. By default this option is false storing the body in binary format.

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

deserializationFilter.label: security
deserializationFilter.description: Sets a deserialization filter while reading Object from Aggregation Repository. By default the filter will allow all java packages and subpackages and all org.apache.camel packages and subpackages, while the remaining will be blacklisted and not deserialized. This parameter should be customized if you're using classes you trust to be deserialized.

jdbcOptimisticLockingExceptionMapper.label: advanced
jdbcOptimisticLockingExceptionMapper.description: Mapper allowing different JDBC vendors to be mapped with vendor specific error codes to an OptimisticLockingException

bean.name: JdbcMessageIdRepository
bean.title: Jdbc Message Id Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses a SQL database to store message ids.

tableName.description: The name of the table to use in the database

createTableIfNotExists.description: Whether to create the table in the database if none exists on startup

tableExistsString.label: advanced
tableExistsString.description: SQL query to use for checking if table exists

createString.label: advanced
createString.description: SQL query to use for creating table

queryString.label: advanced
queryString.description: SQL query to use for check if message id already exists

insertString.label: advanced
insertString.description: SQL query to use for inserting a new message id in the table

deleteString.label: advanced
deleteString.description: SQL query to use for deleting message id from the table

clearString.label: advanced
clearString.description: SQL query to delete all message ids from the table

processorName.description: The name of the processor that are used for this repository. Use unique names to separate processors in the same database.

jdbcTemplate.description: The Spring JdbcTemplate to use for connecting to the database

transactionTemplate.description: The Spring TransactionTemplate to use for connecting to the database

bean.name: KafkaIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Kafka Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses Kafka to store message ids. Uses a local cache of previously seen Message IDs. The topic used must be unique per logical repository (i.e. two routes de-duplicate using different repositories, and different topics) On startup, the instance consumes the full content of the topic, rebuilding the cache to the latest state.

topic.description: Sets the name of the Kafka topic used by this idempotent repository. Each functionally-separate repository should use a different topic.

bootstrapServers.description: The URL for the kafka brokers to use

groupId.description: A string that uniquely identifies the group of consumer processes to which this consumer belongs. By setting the same group id, multiple processes can indicate that they are all part of the same consumer group.

maxCacheSize.description: Sets the maximum size of the local key cache.

pollDurationMs.description: Sets the poll duration of the Kafka consumer. The local caches are updated immediately; this value will affect how far behind other peers in the cluster are, which are updating their caches from the topic, relative to the idempotent consumer instance issued the cache action message. The default value of this is 100 If setting this value explicitly, be aware that there is a tradeoff between the remote cache liveness and the volume of network traffic between this repository's consumer and the Kafka brokers. The cache warmup process also depends on there being one poll that fetches nothing - this indicates that the stream has been consumed up to the current point. If the poll duration is excessively long for the rate at which messages are sent on the topic, there exists a possibility that the cache cannot be warmed up and will operate in an inconsistent state relative to its peers until it catches up.

startupOnly.description: Whether to sync on startup only, or to continue syncing while Camel is running.

bean.name: LevelDBAggregationRepository
bean.title: Level DBAggregation Repository
bean.description: Aggregation repository that uses LevelDB to store exchanges.

persistentFileName.description: Name of file to use for storing data

returnOldExchange.label: advanced
returnOldExchange.description: Whether to return the old exchange when adding new exchanges to the repository

useRecovery.description: Whether or not recovery is enabled

recoveryInterval.description: Sets the interval between recovery scans

maximumRedeliveries.description: Sets an optional limit of the number of redelivery attempt of recovered Exchange should be attempted, before its exhausted. When this limit is hit, then the Exchange is moved to the dead letter channel.

deadLetterUri.description: Sets an optional dead letter channel which exhausted recovered Exchange should be send to.

allowSerializedHeaders.label: advanced
allowSerializedHeaders.description: Whether headers on the Exchange that are Java objects and Serializable should be included and saved to the repository

serializer.label: advanced
serializer.description: To use a custom serializer for LevelDB

bean.name: MemoryAggregationRepository
bean.title: Memory Aggregation Repository
bean.description: A memory based AggregationRepository which stores Exchange in memory only.

bean.name: MemoryIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Memory Idempotent Repository
bean.description: A memory based IdempotentRepository.

cacheSize.description: Maximum elements that can be stored in-memory

bean.name: MongoDbIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Mongo Db Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses MongoDB to store message ids.

mongoClient.description: The MongoClient to use for connecting to the MongoDB server

bean.name: OpensearchBulkRequestAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Opensearch Bulk Request Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregates two OpenSearch BulkOperation into a single BulkRequest

bean.name: SimpleScheduledRoutePolicy
bean.title: Simple Scheduled Route Policy
bean.description: A basic RoutePolicy that can be used to start/stop routes using fixed intervals.

routeStartRepeatCount.description: Maximum number of times the route should be started

routeStartRepeatInterval.description: Interval (in millis) how often the route should be started

routeStopRepeatCount.description: Maximum number of times the route should be stopped

routeStopRepeatInterval.description: Interval (in millis) how often the route should be stopped

routeSuspendRepeatCount.label: advanced
routeSuspendRepeatCount.description: Maximum number of times the route should be suspended

routeSuspendRepeatInterval.label: advanced
routeSuspendRepeatInterval.description: Interval (in millis) how often the route should be suspended

routeResumeRepeatCount.label: advanced
routeResumeRepeatCount.description: Maximum number of times the route should be resumed

routeResumeRepeatInterval.label: advanced
routeResumeRepeatInterval.description: Interval (in millis) how often the route should be resumed

bean.name: SpringRedisIdempotentRepository
bean.title: Spring Redis Idempotent Repository
bean.description: Idempotent repository that uses Redis to store message ids.

flushOnStartup.label: advanced
flushOnStartup.description: Delete all keys of the currently selected database. Be careful if enabling this as all existing data will be deleted.

bean.name: StringAggregationStrategy
bean.title: String Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: Aggregate result of pick expression into a single combined Exchange holding all the aggregated bodies in a String as the message body. This aggregation strategy can used in combination with Splitter to batch messages

delimiter.description: Delimiter used for joining strings together.

bean.name: TarAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Tar Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: AggregationStrategy to combine together incoming messages into a tar file. Please note that this aggregation strategy requires eager completion check to work properly.

filePrefix.description: Sets the prefix that will be used when creating the TAR filename.

fileSuffix.description: Sets the suffix that will be used when creating the TAR filename.

preserveFolderStructure.label: advanced
preserveFolderStructure.description: If the incoming message is from a file, then the folder structure of said file can be preserved

useFilenameHeader.label: advanced
useFilenameHeader.description: Whether to use CamelFileName header for the filename instead of using unique message id

parentDir.label: advanced
parentDir.description: Sets the parent directory to use for writing temporary files

bean.name: ThrottlingExceptionRoutePolicy
bean.title: Throttling Exception Route Policy
bean.description: A throttle based RoutePolicy which is modelled after the circuit breaker and will stop consuming from an endpoint based on the type of exceptions that are thrown and the threshold settings.

failureThreshold.description: How many failed messages within the window would trigger the circuit breaker to open

failureWindow.description: Sliding window for how long time to go back (in millis) when counting number of failures

halfOpenAfter.description: Interval (in millis) for how often to check whether a currently open circuit breaker may work again

keepOpen.description: Whether to always keep the circuit breaker open (never closes). This is only intended for development and testing purposes.

exceptions.description: Allows to only throttle based on certain types of exceptions. Multiple exceptions (use FQN class name) can be separated by comma.

halfOpenHandler.label: advanced
halfOpenHandler.description: Custom check to perform whether the circuit breaker can move to half-open state. If set then this is used instead of resuming the route.

bean.name: ThrottlingInflightRoutePolicy
bean.title: Throttling Inflight Route Policy
bean.description: A throttle based RoutePolicy which is capable of dynamic throttling a route based on number of current inflight exchanges.

scope.description: Sets which scope the throttling should be based upon, either route or total scoped.

maxInflightExchanges.description: Sets the upper limit of number of concurrent inflight exchanges at which point reached the throttler should suspend the route.

resumePercentOfMax.description: Sets at which percentage of the max the throttler should start resuming the route.

loggingLevel.description: Sets the logging level to report the throttling activity.

bean.name: UseLatestAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Use Latest Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: An AggregationStrategy which just uses the latest exchange which is useful for status messages where old status messages have no real value. Another example is things like market data prices, where old stock prices are not that relevant, only the current price is.

bean.name: UseOriginalAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Use Original Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: An AggregationStrategy which just uses the original exchange which can be needed when you want to preserve the original Exchange. For example when splitting an Exchange and then you may want to keep routing using the original Exchange.

bean.name: XsltAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Xslt Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: The XSLT Aggregation Strategy enables you to use XSL stylesheets to aggregate messages.

xslFile.description: The name of the XSL transformation file to use

propertyName.description: The exchange property name that contains the XML payloads as an input

transformerFactoryClass.label: advanced
transformerFactoryClass.description: To use a custom XSLT transformer factory, specified as a FQN class name

output.description: Option to specify which output type to use. Possible values are: string, bytes, DOM, file. The first three options are all in memory based, where as file is streamed directly to a java.io.File. For file you must specify the filename in the IN header with the key XsltConstants.XSLT_FILE_NAME which is also CamelXsltFileName. Also any paths leading to the filename must be created beforehand, otherwise an exception is thrown at runtime.

bean.name: XsltSaxonAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Xslt Saxon Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: The XSLT Aggregation Strategy enables you to use XSL stylesheets to aggregate messages (uses Saxon).

xslFile.description: The name of the XSL transformation file to use

propertyName.description: The exchange property name that contains the XML payloads as an input

output.description: Option to specify which output type to use. Possible values are: string, bytes, DOM, file. The first three options are all in memory based, where as file is streamed directly to a java.io.File. For file you must specify the filename in the IN header with the key XsltConstants.XSLT_FILE_NAME which is also CamelXsltFileName. Also any paths leading to the filename must be created beforehand, otherwise an exception is thrown at runtime.

transformerFactoryClass.label: advanced
transformerFactoryClass.description: To use a custom XSLT transformer factory, specified as a FQN class name

bean.name: ZipAggregationStrategy
bean.title: Zip Aggregation Strategy
bean.description: AggregationStrategy to zip together incoming messages into a zip file. Please note that this aggregation strategy requires eager completion check to work properly.

filePrefix.description: Sets the prefix that will be used when creating the ZIP filename.

fileSuffix.description: Sets the suffix that will be used when creating the ZIP filename.

allowEmptyFiles.label: advanced
allowEmptyFiles.description: Whether to add empty files to the ZIP.

preserveFolderStructure.label: advanced
preserveFolderStructure.description: If the incoming message is from a file, then the folder structure of said file can be preserved

useFilenameHeader.label: advanced
useFilenameHeader.description: Whether to use CamelFileName header for the filename instead of using unique message id

useTempFile.label: advanced
useTempFile.description: Whether to use temporary files for zip manipulations instead of memory.

parentDir.label: advanced
parentDir.description: Sets the parent directory to use for writing temporary files
